data.text: ALARGAN International Real Estate Company … is now locally hiring "IT Team Leader" for a new Project as below: The IT Team Leader manages IT Dept. covering software Implementation, system administration, along with usual day-2-day helps desk support. Plans, directs, manages and oversees the activities, operations and projects of the IT Department; administer the IT budget, staff and physical facilities of the department. Ensure systems design and implementation efficiency to develop new and/or modifies AUK information processing systems to deliver cost effective, reliable, timely, high-quality computer and telecommunications systems and information services. Job Duties: - Directs and participates in the development of goals, objectives, policies and procedures for the Information Technology Department. - Establishes information technology standards including those for hardware, software and local area networks; coordinates and reviews acquisition of hardware, software and automation-related services, including development and implementation - Translate company mission and objectives into work plan for the IT Department - Manage Service Level Agreements with 3rd Parties, both as service provider, and as a client. - Direct & monitor the daily work of the support team to ensure best IT services for end users - Direct & monitor the daily work of System administrator to ensure best performance of systems infrastructure within the company - Manage the IT Operations team to ensure best IT contribution in the company real estate projects - Direct & monitor the daily work of networks team to insure best performance of network infrastructure in our supported sites. - Manage the business applications team to confirm they provide best service and maximum contribution in the company business processes. - Confirm that backup/restore plans are operational - Plan, direct, and apply IT portion of the company business contingency plan. - Provide direction for IT team members. - Identify opportunities for team training and skills advancement - Recommend employee promotions, salary adjustments, and disciplinary actions and approve vacation and overtime - Maintain and promote staff motivation by addressing employee grievances promptly and escalating when necessary and enforcing fair and equitable compliance with IT policies and procedures. Job Requirements: - 7-10 years of experience. - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field - Professional courses in the Networking and Microsoft systems are required; MCP CCNA, MCSE If you are interested, please send your CV to "hr@alargan.com"
